storyTitle: As Employee, I want to securely access my schedule to protect my personal information

testCases.title: Validate successful login and schedule access
preconditions: Employee has valid registered credentials in the system
Schedule data exists for the employee in the database
Application is accessible via HTTPS
Authentication service is running and available
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Employee opens web browser and navigates to the application login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully displaying username and password input fields, login button, and HTTPS lock icon in browser address bar

steps.action: Employee enters valid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Username is accepted and displayed in the input field (masked or visible based on field type)

steps.action: Employee enters valid password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is accepted and displayed as masked characters (dots or asterisks)

steps.action: Employee clicks the login/submit button
steps.expectedResult: System processes authentication request, validates credentials against authentication service, and completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: System authenticates the employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Authentication succeeds, session token is created and stored, employee is redirected to dashboard or home page, and welcome message or employee name is displayed

steps.action: Employee navigates to the schedule page by clicking on schedule menu or link
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully showing navigation to schedule section

steps.action: System validates session token and retrieves schedule data for the authenticated employee
steps.expectedResult: Only the authenticated employee's schedule data is displayed with correct dates, shifts, and assignments. No other employee's data is visible

steps.action: Verify data transmission is encrypted by checking browser security indicators
steps.expectedResult: HTTPS protocol is active, SSL/TLS certificate is valid, and secure connection icon is displayed in browser

postconditions: Employee is successfully logged in with active session
Employee can view their schedule data
Session token is valid and stored
Access attempt is logged in system logs with timestamp and user ID
All data transmissions were encrypted via HTTPS

testCases.title: Verify access denial with invalid credentials
preconditions: Application login page is accessible
Authentication service is running
Employee is not logged in
Test invalid credentials are prepared (non-existent username or incorrect password)

steps.action: Employee navigates to the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Employee enters invalid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Invalid username is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Employee enters any password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is accepted and displayed as masked characters

steps.action: Employee clicks the login/submit button
steps.expectedResult: System attempts authentication and processes the request

steps.action: System validates the credentials against authentication service
steps.expectedResult: Authentication fails and clear error message is displayed such as 'Invalid username or password. Please try again.' No session is created

steps.action: Employee remains on login page and attempts to directly access schedule page URL by typing schedule URL in browser
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, system redirects to login page with message 'Authentication required. Please log in to access this page.'

steps.action: Verify no schedule data is exposed by checking page source, network traffic, and API responses
steps.expectedResult: No schedule data is visible in page content, no data is returned in API responses, and no sensitive information is leaked in error messages or page source

steps.action: Check system logs for failed authentication attempt
steps.expectedResult: Failed login attempt is logged with timestamp, attempted username (not password), and failure reason

steps.action: Repeat test with valid username but incorrect password
steps.expectedResult: Authentication fails with same error message, no session created, access denied, and attempt is logged

postconditions: Employee is not authenticated and has no active session
No schedule data was exposed or accessible
Failed authentication attempts are logged in system
Employee remains on login page
No security vulnerabilities were exploited

testCases.title: Test session timeout and logout behavior
preconditions: Employee has valid credentials
Session timeout duration is configured in the system (e.g., 15 minutes of inactivity)
Authentication service is running
Employee is not currently logged in
System clock is accurate

steps.action: Employee logs in with valid credentials following standard login process
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated, session is created with timestamp, and employee is redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Employee navigates to schedule page and views their schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data is displayed successfully for the authenticated employee

steps.action: Employee remains idle (no clicks, no keyboard input, no page navigation) for the duration exceeding the configured session timeout period
steps.expectedResult: System monitors session inactivity and tracks time elapsed since last activity

steps.action: Wait for session timeout to trigger (system automatically detects timeout)
steps.expectedResult: Session expires automatically, session token is invalidated, and employee is logged out from the system

steps.action: Employee attempts to access schedule page by clicking on schedule link or refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, session is no longer valid, employee is redirected to login page with message 'Your session has expired. Please log in again.'

steps.action: Verify session token is invalidated by checking session storage and attempting API calls with old token
steps.expectedResult: Session token is removed or marked invalid, API calls return 401 Unauthorized error, and no schedule data is accessible

steps.action: Employee logs in again with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: New session is created successfully and employee can access schedule

steps.action: Employee navigates to schedule page and views schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data is displayed correctly

steps.action: Employee clicks the logout button or link
steps.expectedResult: Logout request is processed by the system

steps.action: System processes manual logout
steps.expectedResult: Session is immediately invalidated, session token is destroyed, employee is redirected to login page with confirmation message 'You have been successfully logged out.'

steps.action: Employee attempts to access schedule page after manual logout by using browser back button or typing schedule URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, employee is redirected to login page, and message indicates authentication is required

steps.action: Verify session invalidation by checking session storage and attempting API calls with old session token
steps.expectedResult: Session token is completely removed, API calls return 401 Unauthorized, and no access is granted to any protected resources

postconditions: All sessions created during test are invalidated
Employee is logged out and on login page
Session timeout and logout events are logged with timestamps and user IDs
No active sessions remain for the test employee
System correctly enforces session security policies

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive error messages when schedule data fails to load to understand issues

testCases.title: Validate error message display on schedule load failure
preconditions: Employee has valid credentials and is logged in
Schedule API endpoint is accessible for testing
Ability to simulate API failure (mock service, network interception, or test environment configuration)
Error message templates are configured in the system
Employee has navigated to the application

steps.action: Configure test environment or use mock service to simulate schedule data retrieval failure (e.g., API returns 500 Internal Server Error, timeout, or network error)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is configured to force schedule API to fail when called

steps.action: System attempts to retrieve schedule data from the API
steps.expectedResult: API call fails as configured, system detects the failure through error response or timeout

steps.action: Employee clicks on schedule menu item or navigates to schedule page URL
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page begins loading and initiates data retrieval request

steps.action: System processes the failed API response
steps.expectedResult: System recognizes the error condition and triggers error handling logic

steps.action: Observe the error message displayed to the employee
steps.expectedResult: Descriptive, user-friendly error message is displayed within 2 seconds of failure detection, such as 'We are unable to load your schedule at this time. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.'

steps.action: Verify error message content for clarity and helpfulness
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly explains the issue without technical jargon, does not expose sensitive system information, and is displayed prominently on the page

steps.action: Employee views the retry option presented in the error message or on the page
steps.expectedResult: Retry button or link is clearly visible and labeled (e.g., 'Retry', 'Try Again', or 'Refresh')

steps.action: Employee views the support contact information presented in the error message
steps.expectedResult: Support contact options are clearly presented, such as 'Contact Support', email address, phone number, or help desk link

steps.action: Verify the presentation and accessibility of retry and support options
steps.expectedResult: Both retry and support options are clearly visible, properly formatted, clickable/actionable, and positioned logically within or near the error message

steps.action: Measure time from failure detection to error message display
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears within 2 seconds of the API failure being detected

postconditions: Error message is displayed to employee
Employee has clear options to retry or contact support
No schedule data is displayed (page shows error state)
System remains stable and responsive
Error is logged in system logs for diagnostics

testCases.title: Verify error logging for diagnostics
preconditions: Employee has valid credentials and is logged in
Error logging system is configured and operational
Access to system error logs is available for verification
Ability to simulate schedule data load error
System clock is accurate for timestamp verification

steps.action: Configure test environment to trigger schedule data load error (e.g., simulate API failure, database connection error, or timeout)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is ready to produce a schedule data retrieval error

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and logged-in employee user ID before triggering the error
steps.expectedResult: Reference timestamp and user ID are recorded for log verification

steps.action: Employee navigates to schedule page to trigger the data load error
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data retrieval is attempted and fails as configured

steps.action: System detects the schedule data load failure
steps.expectedResult: Error is detected and error handling logic is triggered, including logging mechanism

steps.action: System logs the error to the error logging system
steps.expectedResult: Error entry is created in the system logs with all required information

steps.action: Access the system error logs through logging dashboard, log files, or logging service
steps.expectedResult: Error logs are accessible and can be searched or filtered

steps.action: Search for the error log entry corresponding to the triggered schedule load failure using timestamp and user ID
steps.expectedResult: Specific error log entry is located in the logs

steps.action: Review the error log entry for timestamp accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains accurate timestamp matching the time when error occurred (within acceptable margin of seconds)

steps.action: Review the error log entry for user context information
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes user ID, username, or employee identifier of the logged-in employee who experienced the error

steps.action: Review the error log entry for error details and completeness
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains complete and accurate information including: error type/category, error message, API endpoint that failed, HTTP status code (if applicable), stack trace or error source, session ID, and any relevant request parameters

steps.action: Verify log entry provides sufficient information for diagnostics and troubleshooting
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains enough detail for developers or support team to diagnose the root cause, reproduce the issue, and implement a fix

steps.action: Verify no sensitive information (passwords, tokens, personal data) is exposed in the logs
steps.expectedResult: Log entry does not contain sensitive or confidential information that could pose security risks

postconditions: Error is successfully logged in the system
Log entry contains complete diagnostic information
Logs are accessible for review and analysis
No sensitive data is exposed in logs
System continues to function normally after error

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to log out securely to protect my schedule information

testCases.title: Validate successful logout and session invalidation
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee is on any schedule page within the application
Active session exists with valid session token and cookies
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Locate and click the logout button on the current schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is visible and clickable; logout request is sent to POST /api/auth/logout endpoint

steps.action: System processes the logout request and invalidates the session
steps.expectedResult: Session token is invalidated in the session management system; all session cookies are cleared securely; HTTP 200 response is received

steps.action: Observe the page redirection after logout completion
steps.expectedResult: Employee is automatically redirected to the login page; login page is fully displayed with username and password fields visible

steps.action: Verify the total time taken from clicking logout to reaching login page
steps.expectedResult: Entire logout process completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check browser developer tools for session cookies and tokens
steps.expectedResult: All session-related cookies and authentication tokens are removed from browser storage

postconditions: Employee session is completely terminated
All session cookies and tokens are cleared from browser
Employee is on the login page
No residual session data exists in the system
Employee must re-authenticate to access any protected pages

testCases.title: Verify no access after logout
preconditions: Employee was previously logged into the system
Employee has successfully completed logout process
Employee is currently on the login page after logout
Session has been invalidated and cookies cleared
Browser history contains previously accessed schedule page URLs

steps.action: Copy or note the URL of a protected schedule page that was previously accessible
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page URL is available (e.g., /schedule/view or /employee/schedule)

steps.action: Attempt to access the schedule page by entering the URL directly in the browser address bar or using browser back button
steps.expectedResult: Access to the schedule page is denied; system detects invalid/missing session

steps.action: Observe the system response to the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Employee is automatically redirected to the login page; error message or notification may indicate session expired or authentication required

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data or sensitive information is displayed during the redirect
steps.expectedResult: No schedule information is visible; no data leakage occurs during the redirect process

steps.action: Attempt to access multiple different protected pages (e.g., profile, settings, other schedule views) using direct URLs
steps.expectedResult: All attempts are denied; employee is redirected to login page for each attempt; consistent security behavior across all protected resources

postconditions: Employee remains on the login page
No unauthorized access to schedule or protected pages occurred
Session remains invalidated
System security is maintained
Employee must provide valid credentials to regain access
